value:
Weebly very recently updated the way we format our blog links. In the past the links for our blog posts were ungainly and, honestly, a little ugly. See an example from our own blog:
http://blog.weebly.com/2/post/2014/04/start-your-something.html
Notice the "2" and the "2014" and the "04" in there. It's messy. Our new formatting removes all that excess, providing cleaner blog post URLs that look much more like the URLs we use for our standard pages. Here's the same post shown above in the new style:
http://blog.weebly.com/post/start-your-something
Your own blog post links have been cleaned up in this same way.
Does this mean the old links will no longer work? Not at all. All of your older post links automatically redirect to the new version of that same post. To see this in action, click on the http://blog.weebly.com/2/post/2014/04/start-your-something.html link. Notice how it leads directly to the http://blog.weebly.com/post/start-your-something page? 
Any old links from your blog will forward to the new URLs in the same way.
Hope this info helps!

actions.value:
Each blog post has access to a 'Read More' element. You can drag this element between two other elements. When you publish your post, everything above that 'Read More' element will display on the main page of the blog, and everything below will only display if the visitor clicks the 'Read More' link (or the post's title) to read the entire post. 
If you want to split up your post in this way, you will need to put your content in at least two elements. If you write a really long essay, then the first part of the essay should be in its own 'Paragraph' element, and the second part of the essay should be in another 'Paragraph' element. That way you can drag the 'Read More' element between the two of them.
For more information about this, please see:
http://kb.weebly.com/read-more.html

When replying to comments on your blog posts, you must do so from your live website, not from within the Weebly editor. The links are not active in the editor, so you won't be able to reply there.
If you want your comment to show that you are an administrator for the site, you should first log in to your Weebly account, and then go to your published blog to make a comment.  Your comment as an admin will be highlighted and set apart from the other commenters.
If you have any questions about this, please let me know and I'll get right back to you.

An RSS feed element is automatically added to the sidebar of a blog.  RSS allows your blog visitors to easily see updates to your blog in their favorite feed reader.
Learn a bit more about RSS here:
http://kb.weebly.com/rss-feed.html
And about creating a blog here:
http://help.weebly.com/blogs--forums.html

You can create a blog under the 'Pages' tab.  Visit the Blog section of our help site to get step-by-step instructions that show how to get started: 
[Creating a blog](http://kb.weebly.com/new-blog.html)

value:
Tagging a blog post creates a category in the sidebar of your published site.  A visitor can click on a category to view all blog posts that have been tagged with that category.  It's not necessary to tag posts, but it can be a useful way to allow visitors to your site to find and read older posts about specific topics.  
For a full rundown of how to best use the tags / categories, please see:
http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201405086-Create-a-Blog-Post

The BookFresh element is currently not displaying due to issues with the company (BookFresh) that provides element. 
Our developers are actively working with BookFresh to fix this issue. Unfortunately, this element is one of the very few elements that we did not create ourselves so there is nothing we can alter on our end to resolve the problem unfortunately.
I'm truly sorry for this and wish it was fixed already.

actions.value:
You can download your site as a .zip archive under the 'Settings' tab in the 'Archive/Un-publish' area.  Once you've downloaded the zip file, unzip it onto your hard drive and burn the files to a CD or save to a flash drive. Your homepage is named index.html.
Please note that blogs, forms, and some other features may not work when viewed offline.
If you have any further questions about this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

macros.title: Editor::Burn CD / Save Site to Flash Drive / Offline Viewing

actions.value:
If you use a built-in 'Forum' element, you are restricted to one forum per account because you're automatically assigned an account user ID.
However, if you go to either Tal.ki or Nabble.com you can generate as many different forums as you want, and then embed them on your Weebly site using the 'Embed Code' element.
For assistance with the 'Embed Code' element, please see:
http://kb.weebly.com/custom-html.html

The 'Editors' tab enables you to invite any number of other people to help you edit an individual site.  For more information about this, please see:
http://kb.weebly.com/collaborate.html

value: If your editors aren't receiving their invites, this means those invites are going to a junk/spam folder or bouncing back to us. That being the case, go to the 'Editors' tab and look to the right of the invitee's email address. There, you'll see the word "Invitation" underlined as a link. Click that and you'll see the link to the page they need to visit to accept the invitation -- you can email them this link from your personal address to help ensure they receive it.

actions.value:
You can copy a site by using the copy option found under the 'More' button to the right of the site's listing on your main 'Account' page.  Read these short, step-by-step instructions to learn more:
http://kb.weebly.com/copy-site.html

value:
Unfortunately, there is not a way to change the background color of individual elements.  The only backgrounds that can be changed are the backgrounds for the entire body and content areas of the site.  It's impossible, at least currently, to get more specific than that.  I'm sorry that's not a feature we offer yet!
For advanced users it is possible to change the background image or color of the entire page by modifying the CSS and HTML of the design template. Please review the linked guide below for specific instructions:
 [http://kb.weebly.com/background-color.html](http://kb.weebly.com/background-color.html)

Unfortunately, we're not able to provide case by case solutions for custom HTML problems and questions, due to the wide range of uses and associated problems.  There are just too many variables for our team to be able to provide hands-on guidance. Altering the CSS of a theme should be done with the understanding that you should know HTML / CSS thoroughly, and be confident in your ability  to make changes.  
  
You should also check out our guide to making basic changes to the HTML / CSS of a Weebly theme:
    
http://kb.weebly.com/html-css.html
  
And, if you need more information, be sure to visit the W3C Schools Website to read some great free tutorials on how to work with HTML and CSS:
  
http://www.w3schools.com/
Designers often charge thousands of dollars to design sites for a reason.  Writing your own code is not easy.  There's nothing wrong with trying things out, learning how to code, updating your site with customizations we don't include.  But if it's not working for you, the very best thing you can do is stick with one of our standard themes. It's easy to switch over to one of our own themes via the 'Design' tab.

actions.value:
For assistance with the Embed Code element, please see: 
http://kb.weebly.com/custom-html.html

Unfortunately, this is not an available feature yet.  Presently, you can directly modify the HTML & CSS of your website template using the 'Edit HTML / CSS ' option under the 'Design' tab of the editor.  However, this feature should be used only if you're familiar with HTML & CSS code as we do not provide support for problems that may occur while using this area of the editor.  We appreciate your patience as we continue to develop Weebly.
To learn more about how to make basic alterations to a theme, check out this page of our help site:
http://kb.weebly.com/html-css.html

value:
HTML validation errors like the ones you've described here are unavoidable unless you hand write the HTML and CSS for your entire site. Even extremely successful and popular sites like amazon.com generate hundreds upon hundreds of validation errors if you check them. 
A What-You-See-is-What-You-Get editor like ours (or dreamweaver or Squarespace or any other such system) cannot be expected to churn out perfect code.  Validation errors do not mean there is anything wrong with your site. They quite simply mean your code isn't absolutely perfect. Your site will function normally for your visitors and show up as expected in search engine results.

actions.value:
You can add a lot of different kinds of custom features and content to your site via our 'Embed Code' element. This allows you to embed items to your site just by dragging the element down and pasting the code in.
For assistance using the 'Embed Code' element, please see: 
[Using the Embed Code Element](http://kb.weebly.com/custom-html.html)
How do you know if a widget or app is embeddable? The best way is to just ask the provider or search their FAQs to see. There's no reason it won't work so long as they can give you embeddable code for your site.

I'm very sorry for the issues you've been experiencing.  It looks like this problem is being caused by the javascript in your MailChimp form.  It isn't sandboxed (as most JQuery widgets are and should be) so it is interfering with our javascript.  You just need to turn the javascript off and re-create the form.  
The option to turn this off is explained at the top of this tutorial:
http://kb.weebly.com/newsletter-form.html
Add the new opt-in form code, Publish the site, and you'll be all set.
If you continue to run into any issues, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

value: You can edit your site with HTML, CSS, and Javascript; however, Weebly does not support building your site with server side languages, such as PHP or ASP. We also do not currently offer database access, and these options are not likely to become available in the near future.  Very sorry for that!

To delete an element, simply click within that element to "activate" it. You should see an 'x' on the upper right corner. Click this and then confirm that you want to delete the element.  If you run into any issues with this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

actions.value:
Currently, the only way to delete a file is to delete the element used when it was first uploaded. Let's say you created a link from a picture and then uploaded a file when creating that link -- you could only delete the file by deleting the image element and replacing it with a different element. 
This obviously involves a fair amount of work if you have several files to delete. It also requires that you remember the element you originally used to upload the file, which may be long since forgotten. So if you know the specific names of any files you'd like deleted, please just reply to this email with the list, and I will delete the files for you from our end.

value:
While you can install any font you want on your computer, fonts on the web don't work in quite the same way. You can't simply install any font you want to a website and be confident that all visitors to your site will be able to see it. 
Generally speaking it's best (and easiest) to select from the list of fonts found under Design > Design Options. There are a fairly wide range of styles there. 
If you're knowledgeable in CSS you can also assign Google Web Fonts to your site via Design > Edit HTML / CSS. 
http://www.google.com/webfonts/ 
Both our provided fonts and Google's fonts can be seen by any visitor to your site thanks to the way they're designed to work. But a font you've simply downloaded to your computer is not going to be supported in this way and is likely to only be visible to visitors who have also installed it to their own computer. That ultimately defeats the purpose of using the font.  If you have any further questions about this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

macros.title: Editor::Designs/Design Options::Can I Upload My Own Font?

value:
You may be able to use an outside web template, but please note that templates or themes uploaded into Weebly must meet some basic specifications (as you'll see under the 'Documentation' tab of the 'Edit HTML/CSS' area).  
You will most likely have to modify any theme you use so that it meets these criteria, unless that theme has been specifically designed for use with Weebly.  At this time,  we are unable to provide in-depth support for the use of custom themes or scripts.  There are simply too many variables involved for our small team to be able to provide assistance on a case-by-case basis.
Alternatively, you can directly modify the HTML & CSS of a standard Weebly template using the "Edit HTML / CSS " option under the "Designs" tab of the editor.  However, this feature should be used only if you're experienced with HTML & CSS code as we do not provide support for problems that may occur while using this area of the editor.  We appreciate your patience as we continue to develop Weebly.

macros.title: Editor::Designs/Design Options::Can I Upload My Own Theme

value:
Though you can make a lot of changes to your site and theme using our editing tools, the background color / image on some templates can only be changed through the CSS of the theme. We've written a guide to making these changes here:  
http://kb.weebly.com/background-color.html
Note that some experience with HTML / CSS is helpful in making these changes and that altering the background is not something our help desk can directly support. But the changes made in the CSS are fairly simple ones and if you follow along with the guide you'll be on your way. You can also easily switch back to your original, standard theme via the Design tab if you don't like the changes you make in the CSS.
If you'd like to skip the coding and select a template that has built-in support for custom background images, click on the Designs tab and select "Change Theme" then check the box for "Supports backgrounds". This will sort so that the designs that support background images are at the top.

To change the site title, paragraph title, paragraph text, and other fonts for your site, click on the 'Design' tab and then click "Change Fonts". In this area you'll see an area to configure font type, color, size and line height for your site.

actions.value:
You can modify the width of the content area by clicking 'Edit HTML/CSS' on the 'Design' tab. You should only attempt this if you're familiar with HTML & CSS because we're able to provide very limited support for design customizations. Most of the design templates have several different divs that need to be adjusted in order to widen the template.
  
Keep in mind that these themes are set up to display beautifully on monitors of all sizes. If you increase the width of the theme, users with smaller monitors will have to scroll to see the full width of the site.

value: Every theme has a slightly different design for the header image area so we don't transfer header images between themes. I know this can be frustrating since you have to recreate your custom header images, but if we transferred them over there's a very strong chance they'd look awful and you'd have to recreate them anyway.

macros.title: Editor::Designs/Design Options::Custom Headers Don't Transfer Between Themes

value: The fonts that Weebly offers are designed to work regardless of whether someone has them installed on their computer or not -- as a result they're different from standard fonts and can occasionally be weird on certain themes or in certain browsers. Our developers are looking into the problem with this particular font,but for now the only real option is to select a different one. Sorry for that.

actions.value:
You can view (and reselect) your ten most recently used themes using an option found under the 'Design' tab of your account. This should enable you to find the theme you were previously using and connect it to your site again. We have a very short guide to this here:
http://kb.weebly.com/recent-theme.html

value:
The Landing Page layout that you're using always includes a button in the header area. This is not something that can be removed in the editor, however, if you do not use this button it will not appear on the published site. If you have used this button or it is appearing on the published site, there are two simple options to make it go away:

1. Change the Text in the button to read: **Button Text** then also remove the button link, and republish your site. This should hide the button on the live site.

OR

2. Switch to another type of Page Layout via the Pages tab or the gear icon next to the header image. Each of Weebly's design templates includes multiple page layouts to choose from.

Alternately, you can go into the HTML / CSS of the theme (found under Design > HTML / CSS)  and remove the button from the HTML. This requires knowledge of HTML though and should only be done by advanced users.

Currently there are no other options for removing the button from the header area of a Landing Page layout. Very sorry for that!

The themes in your account are global, so changes made to a theme are applied to any site that is using that theme, regardless of which site you're working on when you make the changes.  This is true even when a theme is copied along with a second site. 
To get around this, you would need to create a second version of the theme with a new name. To do so, export the theme (using the link in the lower left corner of the 'Edit HTML/CSS' area), and then rename the zip file that you download. 
Then you can go to the 'Design' tab, select 'Change Themes', and then click on 'My Custom Themes'. From there, you can import your renamed zip file, and then apply the theme to whatever site you want and make changes to it without it affecting the other sites.

actions.value:
I'm very sorry to hear you didn't receive the email! Unfortunately we can't guarantee automated emails like these are going to be delivered to every email address. Some of them get sent to the junk/spam folder by your email provider and some of them are blocked for one reason or another. I know it can be frustrating, but that's simply the nature of email. 
The good news is that it's not necessary to get the email in order to download the .zip file as we also include your last three download links in the Settings > Archive section of the editor. If you go to Settings > Archive now, you'll find a link to download your zip file. This download link is added under settings usually around five minutes after you click the link to generate the zip.  If you run into any issues with this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

value:
You can export your website using the 'Archive to .Zip" option under the 'Settings' tab of the editor.  Please keep in mind that Store pages and Blog pages will not be exported as they rely directly on our database. Some of our elements also may not work correctly when hosted elsewhere, like our 'Contact Form' and 'Slideshow' elements.  If possible, you should try to keep your website hosted on Weebly in order to easily update it.
For more information about this, please see:
http://kb.weebly.com/zip-archive.html
The zip archive cannot currently be used to restore a site back to Weebly, so it is only useful as a personal backup.

Favicons can be tricky because they're stored in a different part of the browser's cache than the rest of your site. Even when you refresh your browser, it may take a day or so for you to see changes to your favicon. Though it may show up right away if you refresh your browser several times in a row (as silly as that probably sounds).  
Anyone who hasn't visited your site recently will see the new favicon without issue.
Learn more about how favicons work by following this short guide: 
http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/204196423

actions.value:
I apologize, but this is not really a Weebly issue as much as the way that some browsers stack Flash and Javascript.  Even when it's coded properly to show the Javascript on top, some browsers insist on putting the Flash (the video) on top. The good news is, you can easily fix this by adding wmode="transparent" to the embed code for the video or other Flash content. 
For more information about this, please see Adobe's comments here:
http://kb2.adobe.com/cps/155/tn_15523.html

I apologize for the confusion.  That particular message stays in place under Forms > Form Entries until you receive your first form submission. So if you were to submit a test entry through your form right now you would immediately be able to see that test entry on the Form Entries page and would no longer see the "no form" message that you're currently seeing. Give that a go and you should be all set!

value:
That bounce message means your address is bouncing the form email back to the senders as undeliverable.  Unfortunately, this is not something we can directly fix or control.  Email delivery can get tricky for these kinds of messages occasionally.  Two options:

1 (and easiest): Switch the form email address to a different one and test that.  You can see how to do that here:

http://kb.weebly.com/form-address.html

2: You can reach out to whoever handles IT for that email address and ask what info they need from us to whitelist your form emails.  Then we can provide whatever info they request.  This would allow the emails to get through.

actions.value:
If you want to change the language on your form fields, you can remove the default, English-titled fields and replace them with 'Short Text Box' elements, which are customizable via the editing toolbar that appears when you click on an element.

For more info on how the contact / survey form works, please see this area of our support center:

[Using the Form Builder](http://kb.weebly.com/contact-form.html)

macros.title: Editor::Forms::Change the Language on Contact Form Fields

value: I'm sorry, but only the shopping cart/checkout pages are SSL secure with our Business Plan.  Data submitted via the "contact form" element is not secure. Please be careful not to collect any sensitive personal or financial data in this manner.

macros.title: Editor::Forms::Are Webforms Secure With the Business Plan SSL?

actions.value:
To change the email address assigned to your 'Contact Form' or add an additional email address to the form, please: 

- Click on the form from within the Weebly editor.

- Then click the "Form Options" button. 

- You should see an "email submissions to:" field appear in the blue toolbar that will appear at the top of the screen. 

- Use this field to remove and replace the email address or to add an additional address.  If you want to connect multiple addresses to your contact form, just separate the addresses with commas. 

For more information about this topic, please see:

[Change Contact Form Address](http://kb.weebly.com/faq-form-address.html)

I apologize for the issues you've been experiencing with the contact form.  Your form appears to be set up correctly. If you don't see the messages in your Inbox, please check your Spam/Junk folders in case the messages are being routed there.  You can also use the 'Form Data' option found under the More button to right of your site listing on your home page to access all the messages that have been submitted through the form.  

Delivering form emails to the inbox can be tricky and there are some situations where the emails may be blocked. If you cannot find the messages in your Inbox or your Spam folders, and you believe the messages really aren't coming through, you may be able to use a different e-mail address with the form and have better results.

You can also associate two email addresses with your contact form temporarily by separating them with commas. To change the email address assigned to your contact form or add an additional email address to receive the form, click on the form from within the Weebly editor and then click the "Form Options" button. You should see an "email submissions to:" field appear on the toolbar where you can remove and replace the email address or add an additional address. Be sure to republish and then test your form!

For more information about this, please see:

http://kb.weebly.com/faq-submissions.html

For details on how the contact / survey form works, please see this area of our support center:

[Using the Form Builder](http://kb.weebly.com/contact-form.html)

value:
To delete Contact Form entries, visit the page in your editor where the Contact Form has been placed.

Click on the form to make it active and you should see an option to 'View Entries'.

Click on 'View Entries', and a screen will pop up with all of your form submissions.  You will see a red x to the left side of each of the submissions.  

Click on the x next to the submission you want to delete and you will see a prompt asking "Are you sure you want to delete this submission?"  

Click OK and the submission will be removed for you.

actions.value:
To export your form entries as a .CSV file please follow these steps:   

1. Log into your Weebly account and select the 'More' button to the right of your site's 'Edit' button.    

2. Then select 'Form Entries' from the drop-down menu.   

3. On the next page, select the form you would like to view from the drop down menu and click on the 'Export Data' link on the right side of your screen.  

4. Lastly, you will be prompted to download the form entries as a .CSV file. Download the file to the selected location on your computer and you are all set.

If you run into any problem with this, please just reply to this email and I will get right back to you.

macros.title: Editor::Forms::Export Contact Form Submissions to CSV

actions.value:
Pro and Business users have access to a file upload field which can be added to a contact form.  Your site visitors can use this field to send you documents and other files (up to 20MB each).  For details on how the contact form works, please see this area of our support center:

[Using the Contact Form](http://kb.weebly.com/contact-form.html)

value:
Spammers target contact forms as an easy place to spout their nonsense. While we do have defenses to help stop this, some do still manage to get through.  If you give it time any wave of spam entries is likely to pass as we fight them off. 

At this time, it's not possible to add a Captcha verification to your Weebly form but the forms do have advanced security measures built in to avoid automated submission and we're constantly tightening up our own security to stop as much spam as possible. There is no way to prevent a malicious user from submitting spam but you should not have a problem with robots submitting your form. I truly apologize for the trouble and annoyance caused by any spam submissions that do slip through.

macros.title: Editor::Forms::No Captcha on Contact Forms / Spam Submissions

actions.value:
To add a forum to your site, drag the 'Tal.ki Forum' element to a page.  This element is available under the 'More' category of elements.

For more details on how to get started with the forum, please see:

[Create and Manage a Forum](http://kb.weebly.com/create-forum.html)

If you don't want to use our Tal.ki forum option, you are more than welcome to use a different forum like nabble.com with your site.  Any embeddable forum will work, and you can add such forums using our 'Embed Code' element.  For assistance with the 'Embed Code' element, please see: 

[Using the Embed Code Element](http://kb.weebly.com/custom-html.html)

value:
If you need help getting started with our service, a great resource is our 'Beginner's Guide to Weebly' which can be found here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/sections/200354313-Beginner-s-Guide-to-Weebly

We also host several free live training sessions every week to walk customers through the ins-and-outs of building a Weebly website.  We encourage you to register to attend any of those sessions here:

http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/sections/200362446-Live-Training-Webcasts

Unfortunately, Weebly sites don't have a built-in guestbook feature,  If you want to have a guestbook, the best approach is to create a blog and use the comments section of a single post as a place where visitors can leave messages that other visitors to the site can read.  

Learn how to set up a blog here:

http://kb.weebly.com/new-blog.html

You can replace any of our default header images with your own images.  For step-by-step instructions on exactly how to upload your own header image and re-size it to fit properly, please see:

[Uploading a Header Image](http://kb.weebly.com/header-images.html)

macros.title: Editor::Headers and Layouts::Create Custom Header Images

value:
You can assign different header images to different pages of your site.  Just use the arrow to the right of the orange 'Save' button when going to save the header.  This will provide you with a number of options as to which pages you'd like to save the header image.  For more information about this, please see:

http://kb.weebly.com/multiple-headers.html

When using one of our themes that supports background images, you can assign different images to different pages of your site.  Just use the arrow to the right of the green 'Save' button when going to save the background image.  This will provide you with a number of options as to which pages you'd like to save the background image

Each page on your site can be assigned one of four different page layouts (some templates may include more layouts).  These layouts are:
  
1. Tall Header: This is the default layout and includes space for a tall header / banner image. 
  
2. Short Header: This includes space for a short header / banner image. 
  
3. No Header: The page layout includes no header area at all. 
  
4. Landing: This layout has space for an image, message, and a button linking to another page from within the header area. 
  
To read more about the different page layouts and how to use them, please take a look at our short guide:
  
http://kb.weebly.com/page-layouts.html 
  
You can freely switch between different layouts, so if you don't like the way one works with a page you can simply choose another without losing any of your content.

Pro users are able to create slideshows in the headers of their pages. These slideshows function in much the same way as our standard slideshows, excepting, of course, that they've been designed to work specifically with the Header of the site.  To learn more about all the banner slideshow options, please see:

http://kb.weebly.com/banner-slideshows.html

I'm truly sorry to hear you're not happy with the changes we've made, but unfortunately, it isn't possible to switch back to the old editor. Our new site creator is here to stay. 

We understand that no matter how many improvements we've made, such a big visual change to our service can be incredibly jarring. Especially if you were just hoping to pop in and make a few changes to your site without having to think too much about it. But other than the major visual changes, the editor continues to work in the exact same way:  

1. You still drag elements to the page to add content. The elements function in the same way they always have (except that a few of them now have some added features): you now drag them from the left instead of from the top. 

2. Some of the elements have new titles, but those titles still describe the same function. For example: "Paragraph" is now called "Text"; "Custom HTML" is now called "Embed Code". 

We have written a short guide to the new site creator that you can read here:

http://kb.weebly.com/site-creator.html

You may also find our Beginner's Guide to Weebly helpful in navigating the new editor: 

http://help.weebly.com/beginners-guide.html

If you have any specific questions about the new Editor, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

macros.title: Editor::I Don't Like the New Editor

value:
We're not currently seeing any problems with image and file uploads, and can't recreate this issue in your account.  There could be a number of causes for the problem you're seeing.  The best way to resolve this is to take a look at our troubleshooting guide:

[Troubleshooting Failed Uploads](http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201505796-I-Can-t-Upload-Images-or-Files-)

This short guide walks through the most common causes (and solutions) for when image and file uploads aren't working.

If you continue to experience any issues after trying those options, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

Our editor doesn't currently support animated gifs in the Header / Logo areas. So any animated gifs you upload to these places will cease to be animated and just become plain old boring gifs. 

You can place animated gifs in the HTML / CSS for the Logo or the Header area but this takes a strong knowledge of CSS and is not for everyone.

However, please note that you can certainly upload animated gifs to picture elements in the content area of the site. Just drag a picture element to the page and upload away!

Once an image has been edited, the option to link it to a larger image (Lightbox) no longer appears. The only way around this is to delete this element, then re-upload the photo. Once you have added these photos, the first thing you should do is link them to a larger version.  I apologize for the inconvenience.

It can be virtually impossible to fully protect any image on the Internet. Unfortunately, if someone wants it, they will find a way to access it.  Pro users have the option to use password protected pages which offer the best form of protection.

To disable right clicking on your pages in some browsers (in order to prevent people from easily copying your text and pictures) paste the following into the "Footer Code" (NOT "footer message") box under the 'Settings' tab in the 'Search Engine Optimization (SEO)' area of the editor.  

    <body oncontextmenu="return false;">

This will be active once your site is published. Again, it will not offer full protection but it may slow some efforts down a bit.

Rather than protect images in this way, some photographers and others with online images choose to use graphics programs to add a watermark or stamp onto the online version of their photos. Although it does not prevent the photo from being stolen, it does protect from use of the photo in most cases since the watermark renders the photo useless.

actions.value: The best approach for uploaded photos are to use JPEGs that are 72 DPI and no more than 1000 pixels on their longest side.

If you're creating a gallery or slideshow, you'll need to orient the pictures before uploading them to Weebly. Sometimes, you can change the orientation of the picture preview on your computer without actually modifying the original file. That's why the picture appears correct on your computer but sideways once you upload. 

To correct this, open the image in whatever photo-editing software you use, rotate the image to the correct orientation, and then save the file. When you upload the new file to Weebly, the photo should appear correctly.

Please note that if you upload the image specifically using our 'Image' Element, you can click the 'Edit' button in the upper right of the image to access our rotate (and other editing) tools.

If you're creating a gallery or slideshow, you'll need to size and crop the pictures before uploading them to Weebly.

To do this, please open the image in whatever photo-editing software you use, ensure that the crop and sizing are correct, and then save the file. Upload the new file to Weebly and the photo should appear correctly.  If you're using a Mac, open the image in iPhoto (or a similar program), size and crop the image and export it.  

Please note that if you upload the image specifically using our 'Image' Element, you can click the 'Edit' button in the upper right of the image to access our editing tools.  Unfortunately these features are not currently available within our gallery and slideshow elements. Very sorry for that!

You can adjust this a bit by going to the 'Advanced' section of the slideshow editor (this is available on the blue toolbar that pops up when you click on the slideshow).  If you have any further questions about this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

Weebly currently has an iPhone and Android app that can be downloaded directly from the iTunes and Google Play Stores.  Please note that the existing apps can be used on tablets, but were not specifically designed to take advantage of the extra screen real estate on an iPad/Android tablet.  

Download the iPhone app here:

http://itunes.apple.com/us/app/weebly/id511158309?mt=8 


Download the Android app here: 

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.weebly.android

We are big mobile fans and the existence of only an iPhone and Android app is not due to us not caring or not being aware of the existence of these products.  It's just that creating a blog post or editing an entire site requires a lot of moving parts so we're having to think through how we want to approach mobile editing on this larger screened platform.  

Note that our websites, our video player and slideshows are HTML based and work just fine on our published sites with all iOS, Android, Windows and BlackBerry devices.  It's only editing itself that is limited to the iPhone and Android apps.

The capabilities of a smart phone enable us to offer a great complimentary experience to the Weebly web builder and our iPad tablet apps, but site-wide editing would be extremely difficult to accomplish on a smart phone.

Right now, you can manage blog and store pages as well as viewing form submissions and stats using the app for your phone, but you cannot edit/build your entire site using your phone. Our mobile blog posting interface is impressive and we'll be building on that functionality in the future, but in the meantime you can download our app for iPad for more editing functionality.

Weebly automatically generates a mobile version of your site for viewing on iOS, Android, Blackberry and other smartphone platforms.  You can choose a theme (many with multiple color schemes) for the mobile version of a site by clicking on the smartphone icon in the upper right-hand corner of the main Editor, next to the 'Publish' button. 

You can also turn the mobile version off from the 'Settings' tab, so that the standard version of your site is displayed to mobile visitors. 

This, however, is the limit of what you can do with the mobile version of the site.  Unfortunately, if you don't like the way it looks on your particular phone there isn't anything that you or we can do about that.  If you're unhappy with the way the mobile version of your site looks, your best option is to turn off the mobile version entirely and have your site load normally on smartphone platforms.  

Any good smartphone will display your standard Weebly site perfectly.  And as nearly all active internet-browsing mobile users are on iPhones or Android phones, you can feel confident that your site will look good to those visitors if you turn the mobile version off. 

I apologize for the current limitations and thank you for your patience as we continue to develop Weebly.

Weebly automatically generates a mobile version of your site for viewing on iOS, Android, Blackberry and other smartphone platforms. 1. Scroll over the element. 

2. Click the blue arrow in the upper left of the element.

value:
It's not immediately obvious, but you can quickly and easily move or copy an entire set of columns (and all the content within those columns) with just a few clicks of your mouse. 

How can you do that? We have a really short guide (with a few screenshots) that shows exactly how to do what you're looking to do:

https://weebly.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/202511666

We’ve made some significant updates to how elements can be arranged on a page. At first glance, that may make it appear that Weebly no longer works in a way that you expect it to work. I’m truly sorry for that. 

But I also promise that the changes we’ve made here dramatically improve the way our columns (and our entire editor) works. We have a short video that details all of the changes and I think it’s worth a look: 

https://weebly.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/202497066

Here’s a breakdown of the changes we’ve made (which is also covered in the video and at the above page): 
 
Update #1: Columns are created automatically
Whereas before you needed to use the old Columns element to place one element next to another, you can now simply drag elements next to each other right on the page. Doing so creates two or three or four or however many columns you need. These then function just like the Columns element previously did. 

Update #2: Column widths snap to a grid
As before, you can adjust the width of a column simply by dragging the blue line that divides two columns. To help keep column widths consistent between pages we've introduced a grid system to which all columns snap. If you want to break free of this grid, just hold "Shift" while you drag the column divider line and you can drag it wherever you like. 

Update #3: New Behavior for Moving and Copying Columns
It may appear that the options to "Move" and "Copy" a set of columns has been removed. But this isn't the case at all. You simply have to click on one of the divider lines in that set of columns and the move / copy controls will appear in the upper left of the columns as always.

Update #4: New Text+Image Behavior
We've removed the Text+Image element because you can now drag an image right on to (or out of) a block of text. This makes it much simpler to add an image to a page and allow text to wrap around it. 

Update #5: New Spacer Element
We've added a new Spacer Element so you add extra space to a page as needed. This element can be made as wide or as tall as needed to ensure it best fits your design. 

If what I’ve described here does not fit with what you’re seeing, can you give me a little more detail so I can look into this issue and get it fixed for you? I promise we’ll make sure things work better for you than ever before.

Unfortunately, we don't currently offer a mailing list opt-in form directly through the Editor.  However, you can create such a form with an email provider like MailChimp or AWeber and then add it to your site via our 'Embed Custom HTML' element.  For more information about this, please see:

[Add an E-Mail Newsletter/Autoresponder Form](http://kb.weebly.com/newsletter-form.html)

Pasting text from other sources can bring fonts and hidden code from those sources along with it. This external formatting can cause conflicts and errors on any website. In the best case scenario, the pasted text becomes unpredictable and difficult to control. In many cases, the external formatting code "breaks" other code on the site and causes the page not to load for some users.  It may work for you for a month and then break your formatting without warning. 

To fix any of these formatting issues just select / highlight any text that has a different font and click the Tx button in the text toolbar. This will strip the extra formatting and cause the text to snap to whatever font you have selected for your site under Design > Design Options.

The best approach to avoid these issues altogether is to copy and paste your text from Word into a plain text document, and then adjust the formatting within Weebly.  You can create plain text documents via the NotePad program on PC or the TextEdit program on Mac. 

Though Word (and similar programs) use formatting that can destroy the font formatting of a webpage, pasting from Plain Text works perfectly.

If you have any further questions about this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

Unfortunately, Weebly does not have a built-in podcasting element. It is possible to set up a podcast in Weebly but there are several steps involved and we're somewhat limited in the support we can provide for this process. Here are the instructions if you want to give it a try:

**UPLOAD THE AUDIO FILE**

You'll need to use a File element (not the audio element) to upload your mp3 file.

**CREATE THE XML**

You can use the free tool at http://webnet77.com/podcast-rss/index.pl/PODS to create an XML file with the basic information about your podcast. 

This produces XML markup with one tag. 

Paste this content into an XML file on your computer using a text editor like notepad or textedit and save it as podcast.xml.

Note: You will need the URL of your mp3. You can get this by opening the page with the audio file in your *live site*, and right or control-clicking to copy the link.

You may need to add the file size of your mp3 in bytes if the "auto" setting in the XML generator doesn't work with your file.

**UPLOAD THE XML**

Add a File element to a page in your Weebly site and upload the XML file you made in the last step. 

Publish your site, then right- or Control-click the link and copy the URL of the file. This is the "Podcast URL" that you'll provide to iTunes.

**UPDATE THE XML**

For each episode you produce, you'll have to upload the audio file, and re-upload the XML. iTunes should update automatically.

To publish, simply log in at Weebly.com, click on the 'Edit Site' link and then click the orange 'Publish' button in the upper right-hand corner of the editor. When your site is finished publishing, you'll see a confirmation message appear with a link to your live site.  For more information about publishing your site, please see:

http://kb.weebly.com/faq-publish.html

To change the web address (URL) of your website, simply click on the 'Settings' tab of the Editor, then click on 'Change Site Address'.  From here, you can choose a different address.  Once complete, just re-publish your site and you should be good to go.  For more information about this, please see:

http://kb.weebly.com/faq-site-address.html

Please note if you have purchased a custom domain name outside of Weebly, you will need to be subscribed to either our Starter or Pro Plans to connect it to your site.

Each individual blog post includes space for unlimited comments but we do not currently have a built-in option to add comments to regular pages.

For more information on using the 'Embed HTML Code' Element, please see:

http://kb.weebly.com/custom-html.html

When you Publish a site you are making the edited version of the site live. However, this version of the site is not frozen until you (or anyone else on earth) takes at least one look at the site. This is simply due to how our Publishing mechanism works. 

Next time you Publish click the link that comes up to view the site. Doing so will "lock" the published version so that no new content shows up until next time you Publish the site. Doing this every time you publish will ensure you never encounter the problem again.

To create a custom 404 page for your site:  

* Log into your account at Weebly.com, open the Editor for the site you wish to edit, and click on the 'Pages' tab.

* Create a new page named "404" (without the quotes).

* Make the page hidden. To create hidden pages, please see:

  http://kb.weebly.com/hidden-pages.html

* Edit the page to add whatever message you want your users to see when they click on a broken link to your site.

* Make sure you publish your changes. Your 404 page will replace the default Weebly "Site Not Published" page.

If you run into any problems with any of this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

http://take-a-screenshot.org/

Usually when a page disappears, it's because the page was accidentally renamed, moved, and/or deleted when you were working in the 'Pages' tab.

The best place to start is by checking any new pages you recently created to make sure you didn't accidentally rename your missing pages. If you're unable to locate the missing content on the 'Pages' tab, we have the ability to restore deleted pages to your site. Just please let me know which site you're working on, what the name of the page is, and approximately what date you think it was deleted.  I will do my best to locate and restore your deleted page for you.

For reference (for after you create the page), the URL of a hidden page is the name of the page with "-" appearing in place of any spaces between the words in the name.  For example:

If you name a page "thank you", it's http://www.yourdomainhere.com/thank-you.html.  

If you name a page "thanks", it's http://www.yourdomainhere.com/thanks.html.  

If you name a page "thank you very much" then the URL is http://www.yourdomainhere.com/thank-you-very-much.html.

If you have any further questions about this, please just let me know and I'll get right back to you.

While you can use accented letters in your page names, these accented letters will need to be converted into a format that the internet can handle.  This is why you will see strange results in the url for your site or page.

However, although it may look incorrect to us, computers will be able to read it perfectly.

There's currently no way around this limitation, however I can tell you that this feature has been highly requested and we are working on enabling it for a future release.  I truly apologize for any inconvenience this causes.

macros.title: Editor::Publishing and Pages::Password Protection - Different Passwords

actions.value: I wanted to let you know that our developers are aware of this issue and are working to get it resolved for you. Thank you for your patience.

value:
Unfortunately, files are not password protected at this time, even if they're uploaded to a password protected page.

The reason for this is that all of your site's files and images are stored in a single folder within the site's directory. In order to password protect even a single file, we'd have to put all of your site's files and images behind a password. 

I'm certainly not suggesting this is ideal or acceptable for your situation (and I'm truly sorry you ran into this issue), but it is simply how the password protection works for the time being.  Thank you for your patience and understanding as we continue to develop Weebly.

macros.title: Editor::Publishing and Pages::Password Protection - Files Are Not Protected

value: Your users should not have to enter the site password more than once per session.  Once the password is entered, a visitor can freely browse the password protected areas of the website.  Only when the browser window is completely closed and re-opened will the password again be required.

value: For the vast majority of features, the Editor itself acts as a preview of your site. Generally speaking, what you see in the editor is how your live site will look.  However, there are a few features that you may want or need to check on prior to releasing your live site. In those instances, you may want to publish just long enough to check the functionality and then unpublish the site using the option to do so found under the 'Settings' tab of the Editor.

When your Published version of your site looks different than the version in the editor, it almost always means one of two things:

1.  That you haven't Published the site since you've made your changes (I'm sure you've likely done this, but I mention it just in case).  Please make sure that you published the latest version by pressing the "publish" button in the editor.  

2.  A browser will often display a cached/outdated version of a site to provide a faster browsing experience.  This can make your recently published site look different or even broken.  Clearing your browser's cache forces the browser to display the site's latest version.  

If you're not sure how to clear your cache, please see step-by step instructions here:

http://www.wikihow.com/Clear-Your-Browser's-Cache  

If you still have changes that are not showing up, please let me know **exactly** what is not publishing and I will be happy to take a look for you.

In the Weebly Editor, if you click on the 'Pages' tab at the top, you will see a list of your pages in grey boxes. You can drag a page to the right so that it is underneath and slightly to the right (indented) of the page that you want to be the primary page. It should snap into place, slightly indented. Then next time you publish, it will show up underneath that page in your navigation.

For more help creating subpages, please see [this link](http://kb.weebly.com/subpages.html).

Please keep in mind that it isn't possible to make a top-level navigation page link unclickable so that only the sub-pages can be clicked.  The best work-around for this is to add links directly to the main page that lead to each of the sub-pages.  That way people who click the main page link don't see a blank page.    

For assistance creating links, check out [How to Create Links](http://kb.weebly.com/links.html)

Once you've upgraded to Weebly Starter, Pro, or Business, you can easily customize the footer on your website. For step-by-step instructions on exactly how to do this, please see:

[How Do I Remove/Edit the Weebly Footer](http://kb.weebly.com/faq-footer.html)

If you want to display a list of recent posts from a blog on your site, you can use our 'Feed Reader' element, which is located in the 'Build' tab, under the "More" section (you can click the "..." icon on the top to quickly jump to that section).

Just drag the element to your page, and then click on it to edit the settings.  The feed address is where you enter the RSS feed URL for the blog you want to display.  If you're using it with a Weebly blog, you can get the feed URL from your published blog - just click on the RSS icon in the sidebar and copy the URL.  You can also use this element with other blogs as long as you have the RSS feed URL.

There are a couple other settings you can adjust, like the width of the element and the number of items it will display.  Once you have everything the way you like it, just publish your site again.  Please keep in mind that if the blog page is password protected, the feed reader won't be able to access the blog and therefore it won't work.

For more info about RSS, please see:

http://kb.weebly.com/rss-feed.html

Unfortunately, support for languages written from right to left is not yet available in Weebly.  Currently, you can directly modify the HTML & CSS of your website template using the 'Edit HTML/CSS' option under the 'Designs' tab of the Editor. However, this feature should be used only if you're familiar with HTML & CSS code as we do not provide support for problems that may occur while using this area of the Editor. 

There is some good information on the following website that may help you configure the text on your website accordingly.

http://www.i18nguy.com/markup/right-to-left.html


Please keep in mind that Internet Explorer does not generally work well with the Weebly templates that have a horizontal navigation bar when the direction is right-to-left. For best results, you should select a template that has a vertical navigation bar.

We appreciate your patience and understanding as we continue to develop Weebly.

All of your work is saved as you go, so there is no need to do anything special to save your site.  It is saved for you automatically.  You can just close out of the editor and come back when you're ready -- all of the work you previously created will be there waiting for you.  

The only exception to this rule is when you're working on a blog post.  To save a blog post to work on later (before Publishing it), be sure to click the 'Save to Draft' button at the top of the post.

Unfortunately, the 'Embedded Document / Scribd' element is not currently visible on the mobile version of our sites. We're working with Scribd to figure out the cause of the problem now; as soon as the issue is fixed the embedded documents will start working on the mobile version of your site immediately.  

That said: if you need to fix this problem right away, please go to Settings > Mobile, turn the mobile version of your site off, and then Publish the site again. This will display the desktop version of your site on iOS, Android phones, and other devices (the sites will still work perfectly on each of these devices) allowing Scribd to work normally again.  I truly apologize for the inconvenience and thank you for your understanding as we continue to develop Weebly.

actions.value:
The Embedded Document element is currently responding very slowly due to issues with the company (Scribd) that provides element. 

We are working with Scribd to fix this issue on their side. Unfortunately, the embedded document element is one of the very few elements that we did not create ourselves so there is nothing we can alter on our end to resolve the problem unfortunately.

If you are trying to upload a PDF file, I'd recommend simply linking to it in the interim. Linked PDFs open in a new tab in the browser as illustrated in the first part of this article:

http://kb.weebly.com/documents.html

Linking to PDFs is actually significantly better than embedding them as browsers know what to do with a linked PDF and will display them perfectly.

There is no other way around the problem right now. You may want to use a third-party document viewer to embed your documents (like CrocoDoc.com). You'd upload the document to their service and then add it to your site via our custom html element. For assistance with the custom html element, please see:

http://kb.weebly.com/custom-html.html

Scribd is one of the few elements in our system that is not built or controlled directly by us. So we're at the mercy of Scribd in this case. If we could fix it ourselves it'd already be fixed. I'm truly sorry for this and wish it was fixed already.

While we offer help and troubleshooting for technical problems related to our editor and elements, we don't offer consultation or development services through the support center. Weebly does not currently provide a service to analyze or audit SEO for our users. Our system is completely self-service. While we are more than happy to help out with any questions you have that are of a technical nature, the creation of the site is up to you.

It can take a number of weeks for new websites to get "indexed" in the search engine listings and even longer for a site to show up in the results for specific keywords.  The following page in our support center provides specific steps and information detailing how to get initially indexed and better ranked in search engines, however, this is the only information regarding SEO our support center will be able to provide.

[The Basics of SEO](http://kb.weebly.com/seo.html)

If you need an SEO consultant, there are a number of third-party companies out there that are happy to assist Weebly users. If you search Google for "SEO consultant" you'll see many of them on the first page. While we don't currently endorse any companies or consultants in particular, I'm confident you will be able to find a consultant to help with your individual needs.

It's possible that our authorization allowing you to post updates to your twitter account can expire out of the blue. This is due to a weird quirk in Twitter (unfortunately) and doesn't look to be something we can fix on our side. 

That said, this is fairly easy to quickly fix via your Twitter account. We've written a short guide to this here:

http://kb.weebly.com/twitter-authorization.html

Follow along with the guide and you'll be on your way. Sorry for the trouble!

The reason that not all of the tweets are being displayed in the count on your blog buttons is because not every tweet is generated through the post buttons. The ones that are will always show up in the count, but at the moment, if someone visits your blog and then copies the URL to your post and goes to Twitter and pastes that link, it would not show up in the count.

This is because the tweet buttons are currently set up to work with the old blog URLs in order to keep the tweet counts intact on older posts. Our developers are currently working on a solution for the tweet buttons, but for the time being you may see a discrepancy between what's displayed on your post button versus the actual number of tweets at Twitter.

Please note that people can still tweet your posts no matter what - it's just the displayed count on the button on each post that is not showing the full total. It won't affect peoples' ability to tweet your posts at all.

Very sorry for the frustration!

Unfortunately, the Tal.ki forum is not a service provided directly by Weebly and it is not a tool over which we have even the slightest control.  This is one of only two elements that are not built by us.  We added it to our editor in partnership with Tal.ki in order to provide our users an easy way to simply drag a forum on to their site.  

There are two options going forward:

1 -- Stick with the forum you have.  It should be available and working again shortly.  

2 -- Start a new forum via a tool like nabble.com.  It's easy to add a Nabble forum to your site and Nabble has been around for a long time.  Pretty confident they're not going anywhere. 

When you build a forum with a tool like Nabble.com they give you embed code to use to add the forum to your site.  All you'd need to do to place it on your Weebly site is copy & paste that code into one of our Custom HTML Elements.  Learn how to use the custom HTML element here:

http://kb.weebly.com/custom-html.html

Unfortunately, at this time, student accounts cannot be set up as editors. When you invite a student as an editor, strange things can happen as the system tries to process that request and make it work. Ultimately, you will wind up with errors because it's just not allowed.

We have had a few requests from teachers to allow students to edit the class website and that's something that we hope to have in place before the next school year starts, but for now, the only option is to have each student work on their own website in their own account and then link to each of those from the class site. We appreciate your patience while we continue to develop Weebly.

Our editor allows for people to create an ADA compatible website, but we are not able to ensure that each customer's website meets those requirements.

However, the editor itself may not be completely compliant, as it requires users to drag and drop elements in order to build the website.

actions.value:
There are settings in the Internet Explorer browser that interfere with our editor when active, and it sounds like these settings are the cause of the problems you're seeing. Happily, these settings can be easily shut off. 

In IE 9 and 10, right click in the top title bar and choose to display the "Command Bar". In that bar is a "Tools" drop down menu - click it. Under "Compatibility View settings" it is possible that Weebly has been added to "Websites you've added to Compatibility View" - If Weebly appears there, simply remove it.  

Make sure the "Display all websites in Compatibility View" box is NOT checked. This mode of IE tells it to open the site using a very old tools that we do not support, so our editor will not work in IE's Compatibility View. Turning it off ensures that our service will work perfectly. 

And a reminder that if you use Internet Explorer 8 (or earlier) our service will not work at all. You'll need to upgrade to a newer version of IE or download another browser like the ones shown here:

http://whatbrowser.org/

macros.title: General::Browser::IE Stuck in Compatibility Mode (and IE7/IE8 Not Supported)

The problem is that websites are designed to be viewed on a screen and not to be printed directly from the web browser. You can print a webpage, but it is likely not going to look the way you expect it to, and this would be true of most any website.  If you are interested in learning more about this issue and what you can do that might help, check out the following page for more information:

http://windows.microsoft.com/en-US/windows7/Printing-webpages-frequently-asked-questions


If you're concerned about your header image not printing, check your browser's Print options. It's in different places on different browsers but there should be a box you can check to "print background colors and images". That is typically turned off by default in order to conserve ink but when you turn it on, your header image and other layout images will print. 

You may have better results simply taking a screenshot of the content you wish to print, then printing from the image directly.

If you aren't sure how to take a screenshot on your computer, please refer to the following page for simple instructions:

http://take-a-screenshot.org/

Some of our design templates display the site title at the top of the page in an H1 tag. You specify this title under Settings. At this time, the only way to manually add an H1 tag would be using a Custom HTML element or modifying the HTML of the design template.

You can add H2 tags throughout your site by dragging Title elements to the page where needed.  These H2 tags act as "headlines" which can break a page up into different sections in the eyes of the search engines.

If you want to hide an individual page from the search results you need to use our "Hide Page from Search" setting that's found under Pages > Advanced Settings. Every page has an Advanced Settings link where you can access this setting.  Follow our short guide for help with this:

http://kb.weebly.com/hidden-search.html

Note that this will hide the page from your own site search as well as Google and other public search engines. 

Also note that the other Page setting called "Hide Page from Navigation" does not hide that page from search results; all it does is remove the page from your navigation menu so that no link to it appears in your site's navigation. 

If you want to block search engine access to your entire site (as opposed to just specific pages), you can do so by checking the box next to "Hide site from search engines" under the SEO heading on the Settings tab in the Weebly editor.

Be sure to save and publish your site for these changes to take effect.

When you move a site from one host to another there is always the potential for hitting a few bumps with your SEO. There are a couple of things you should do to keep any such issues to a minimum:

Use our 301 Redirect feature to make sure pages from your previous host are forwarded to your pages at Weebly.

http://kb.weebly.com/301-redirects.html

Note that this is only necessary if the pages you create here have different names than the pages you had at the old host. If the page names are the same, they'll simply open right up as normal. 

And you should also read through our Basics of SEO guide to make sure you're taking all the steps needed with your Weebly site to get great search optimization.

http://kb.weebly.com/seo.html

Weebly automatically creates a blank robots.txt file for your site.  If you look at your robots.txt file (www.yourdomainhere.com/robots.txt), you'll see this text:

User-agent: *
Disallow: /ajax/
Disallow: /apps/

The user-agent: * means that the rules in this file applies to all robots. The "Disallow: /ajax/" and "Disallow: /apps/ " lines mean that robots cannot index any files you've uploaded to your store to sell (you'll see this line even if you're not using the Weebly store). If nothing else is listed, it means that nothing else on your site is disallowed. So all robots can access everything in your site except files that you're selling. If there were anything being blocked, it would show up after the second "disallow" but as long as that is blank, nothing is blocked.  So search engines can find your site. 

If you want to change this and block search engines from indexing your site, go to Settings > SEO and select "Hide site from search engines."  Then Save and Publish.

To learn more about all this, see here:

http://kb.weebly.com/robots.html

You can do some optimization to help ensure your images show up in a Google image search, but it's not as fine-tuned as it is for a regular page search since there's less information for the search engines to work with.

Here are some things you can do:

* Use a descriptive image alt tag
* Embed your images in relevant pages
* Use a relevant heading and/or caption next to the image
* Include relevant descriptive links near the image
* Use descriptive anchor text to link to the image from other pages

If you have any other questions, please let us know.

Sitemaps are automatically created (and updated every time you Publish) for sites on Weebly at http://example.weebly.com/sitemap.xml or http://www.yourdomain.com/sitemap.xml in the case that you're published to your own domain name.  There isn't an option to upload your own sitemap currently.

If search results don't show recent changes you've made to the Title and Description area of your site, keep in mind that this is because search engines are not updated in real-time. It can take anywhere from a couple of days to a few weeks for a change made a page on your site to be reflected in the small preview area shown by a search engine. And there's no way for us as a company or for you individually to speed up this process, though Google is usually speedier about indexing your site if you set up a free Webmaster account with them. Our short guide walks through this process if you'd like to give it a go:  

https://weebly.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/201723433-Verify-Your-Site-with-Search-Engines

And note that if a visitor clicks on the link to your site provided by the search engine they'll see the newest version of your site. There is no delay with that at all. It's only the preview area shown in the search engine results that takes time to update.

macros.title: General::SEO::Updates Not Reflected in Search Engine Results

The statistics in Weebly are displaying daily pageviews.  This measure counts each visit of a page as one view.  Thus, if a person reloads the homepage of your site 3 times, it would count as three views.

We also have stats for unique views -- a unique visitor is someone who has not visited your site in the past 7 days. So if I visited your site and visited four pages, I'd count as one Unique View and four Page Views. Hope this helps! 

For even more detailed statistics about your website traffic, you can add Google Analytics to your website.  To do so, please follow these instructions in our support area.

The links you're seeing on your site are not being added or caused by anything we're doing here at Weebly.  This issue is caused by one of two things:

1). Malware on your computer or in your browser. If you check your site from another computer, you won't see any ads because they're not actually part of your webpage. You should run a full virus scan on your computer and if the problem persists, try something like Adaware (http://www.lavasoft.com/products/ad_aware_free.php) which searches for and disables adware in particular. Or try this very easy guide to removing it:

http://botcrawl.com/how-to-remove-text-enhance/

OR

2). Third party code on your site that is overtaking your content to serve ads.  This is most commonly caused by a click counter.  If you have a click counter at the bottom of your site somewhere, I'd recommend removing it. 

I cannot stress enough that Weebly does not and will not run ads on your website.  We are a profitable company and the reason we're profitable is because many of our users upgrade to our Pro / Domain services.  If we treated our free users (or paid users) poorly and placed ads on their sites without their permission then no one would want to upgrade or renew.

Sorry for the noticeable change in stats! Our engineers discovered that we've been tracking bots and web crawlers as stats for the last few months. This could have incorrectly inflated the Page Views of your site. Our Engineers and Operations team were able to fix this issue, but this means that going forward your Page Views will be lower than previously.

If you want to add tracking beyond our own (which is never a bad idea), we'd recommend Google Analytics. Just follow these instructions from our help center:
http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201979698-Google-Analytics

Sorry for the noticeable change in stats! We discovered we've been over counting Unique Visitors, sometimes accidentally counting the same person as multiple visitors. This means that going forward your Unique Visitor number will be lower than it was previously, though your Page View number should remain the same since we weren't over counting views, just the number of unique people who were making those views.

If you want to add tracking beyond our own (which is never a bad idea), we'd recommend Google Analytics. Just follow these instructions from our help center:
http://hc.weebly.com/hc/en-us/articles/201979698-Google-Analytics

actions.value:
We track views and unique visitors by IP Address whereas Google Analytics does it by setting a cookie.

Cookies notoriously undercount visits (as cookies might be disabled or otherwise blocked, they may not expire between visits taken to the site over multiple days, or the visitor may leave the page before the cookie is processed) and IP tracking can over-count them since automated visits are included and some ISPs assign roving IPs to their customers that change constantly.  Generally, the exact number of unique human visitors is somewhere towards the middle, between Weebly and Google.

This is not a flaw in Weebly's stats (or Google's), it's just that there will always be differences between server stats and third-party stats.

To disable auto-renew:

- Log into your account

- Click the Billing tab.

- Any and all paid services you currently have with us will be listed there with the option to disable auto-renew if it is turned on.  Just click the provided link to turn it off. 

If there is no option or auto-renew is set to off, that means you already set to NOT be automatically charged on the renewal date.  In this case, you won't need to change anything to turn the auto-renewal off (since it already is off).  
  
You can also delete any saved CC info from your account by going to Billing > Payment Methods.

Weebly is a very small company in terms of staff. We don't have a separate billing department to send out bills and process manual payments. All billing notices are automated and come from an @weebly.com e-mail address to the e-mail associated with your Weebly account. Legitimate billing notices will always direct you to log into your Weebly account to update your billing information and make any payments due or contact support@weebly.com or billing@weebly.com with any questions. We NEVER send out paper reminders and we only accept payments by credit card or Paypal - never by check or over the phone.


Any time you receive a "bill" that doesn't meet these criteria, a red flag should go up. You can log into Weebly and click "Billing" to view the status of all your paid services and, of course, you can always e-mail support@weebly.com to confirm anything that is unclear.

At this time, we're able to accept American Express, Visa, MasterCard, and Discover credit cards, or PayPal payments.  PayPal allows you to withdraw money from a bank account in order to make the purchase, which is convenient if accepted credit cards are not an option for you.
You can print an invoice for your purchase via the Order History tab under the Billing section of your account.  You'll find a Print Receipt link next to all your previous purchases.

As our subscriptions are paid in advance, we can't provide pro-rated refunds after more than a few months of service.  Our credit card processor doesn't even allow us to run refunds on charges after a few months. 

Can I help you put the account to better use?  Would you like to transfer the service to another account?

To renew your expired service, log in to your account and click on the 'Billing' tab. You'll see all of your paid services and a link to renew/extend each one. 

Once your information is updated, the charge will process and your service will be re-activated. Please update your billing information as soon as possible to avoid a situation where your service expires outside of our control.

actions.value: I apologize for the confusion with your order! The coupon actually expired before you made your purchase which is why the discount was not applied. I will be glad to refund the value of the coupon, but I have to wait until the charge has processed (usually 24 hours). I will e-mail you when this is done. I appreciate your patience!

If the transaction is declined, it means the bank/credit card company blocked it for some reason. Insufficient funds is one common reason but there are many others. It could be something as simple as a slight mismatch between the name/address you entered in Weebly and what the bank has on file or something about the transaction may have appeared suspicious. To protect your privacy, we're only able to see that the transaction was declined - we can't see the reason. Only the bank can tell you that.

A voided charge will not appear as a refund on your debit card statement because we never actually put the charge through.  Instead, the charge simply disappears from your statement.  The length of time it takes for this to happen is dependent on the length of time it takes your bank to release the funds back to you.  Some banks take a couple of days, some banks take more than a week. 

I want to stress that we did not actually charge the card at any time.  We did a check with the bank to see if the money was available and, as it was, your bank sat the money aside so that it would still be available when the charge went through.  Since we cancelled that charge (and it never went through at all) the bank will simply put the money back and delete the charge as if it never happened.

The only receipts we currently provide for purchases are those found under Order History in the Billing tab of your account. You'll find a Print Receipt link next to all of your previous purchases in this section.

We're unable to further customize these receipts, add more information to them, change the name of the person listed on the receipt, or create custom invoices. Not because we just don't want to do so, but simply because altering information after the purchase has gone through is something we're wary of doing for a number of reasons and because we have a small accounting staff here that simply doesn't have the free time to manually create invoices on request.  

I'm truly sorry that we can't create a more detailed invoice for you!
